poem:
**Echoes of Silence**

In a far land, echoes fade,  
families wait by the phone;  
grief spills over borders,  
papers shuffled, words unknown.  
  
Three names linger in the air—   
Akeel, Hannaa, Sara—  
a geometry of loss.  
  
Time trudges slowly,  
the quiet between calls—  
a stillness louder than words.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The family of Akeel Nanabawa and Hannaa Vorajee and their four-year-old daughter Sara Nanabawa are calling on the UK government to improve how it is communicating with the family". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
